title: 20-50-100 Years Ago -- Oct. 26
full text:
Oct. 26--     Oct. 26--100 Years Ago
Oct. 26, 1919
This date was a Sunday. The Frederick News-Post did not publish a Sunday edition at this time.
50 Years Ago
Oct. 26, 1969
This date was a Sunday. The Frederick News-Post did not publish a Sunday edition at this time.
20 Years Ago
Oct. 26, 1999
Two large linden trees in front of Frederick's City hall will be cut down on Wednesday. The trees are in poor condition and pose a hazard to people walking beneath them, according to John Leaf, of the Maryland Department of the Environment Forest Services division. Fred Eisenhart Jr., city public works director, said the trees have been "creating a safety risk. This year we've had falling branches nearly hit pedestrians three different times."
The gun that an Urbana High student took to school Monday was only a toy, but it was enough to get the 18-year-old kicked out of school. The male student was riding the school bus to Urbana when he pulled out the realistic toy gun, silver with a black handle, and showed it to two other students, said Deputy Richard Cook of the Frederick County Sheriff's Office.
The man who headed fire and emergency medical services at the Summer Olympics in Atlanta has been appointed Chief Operating Officer of the U.S. Fire Administration (USFA). Kenneth O. Burris Jr. said it's his job to set the direction and policy of the USFA. "This is a crossroads for the USFA," he said. With the increased emphasis on terrorism, Mr. Burris said the nation's first responders have to be involved in every facet of planning and training.
